The management reshuffle has been brought about to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Eric Schmidt said. Fending off the suggestion that the pressure it was feeling from the rise of Facebook had forced the change, Mr Eric Schmidt added: This is definitely not because of any one competitor. It's about the rate at which we operate. Debate about whether Google has lost its edge has been rife in Silicon Valley tech circles in recent months.
